title: Can Ninja Tabi not be nerfed if ADCs aren't being nerfed?

embed.description: ( Warning : PBE Content is tentative and subject to change - what you see below may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers at the end of the cycle! Manage your expectations accordingly.)

body:
I don't think the bruiser lifeline to ADCs killing them in 4-5 auto attacks being nerfed is very fun, unless you're nerfing ADCs to compensate.

Something like reducing the Critical Damage boost on IE to 40% or something and/or 10 AD off IE.

{{item:3047}} reduce 10% flat to auto attacks and then 1-6% depending on armor.  So at 100 ad they reduce about 1 to 1-1/2 {{item:1036}} worth of AD or about 500 gold worth of gold. Tabi are an 800 gold upgrade. They aren't cost effective yet let alone "countering 6000 gold" at this point.

At 200 AD they're providing about a {{item:1037}}  damage reduction, so about cost neutral. 

At 300 AD they're starting to prevent a {{item:1037}} {{item:1036}}  So a slight advantage to the  to tabi's but more in the range of countering 1200 gold for 800 golds cost. Of course at this point {{item:3035}} is a very real thing since the price of {{item:1037}} being 875 and last whisper being 1300 the effective cost of the passive armor shred is 425 and providing about 6% extra damage via armor shred or about 700 gold worth of AD or a bonus of about 275 gold. Leaving us with a grand total of Tabi being 125 gold ahead. 

TL;DR tabi isn't cost effective in the early game, is cost neutral mid game and countering an extra few hundred worth of gold in the late game, but nothing remotely close to busted.
